subject: Technology
title: Bioethics: Drawing the Line
description: A short lesson to help you apply Bioethics: Drawing the Line.

hook.text: Just because we can do something doesn't mean we should. Biotech forces humanity to decide where the boundaries are.

buildup.text: Should we edit human embryos? Clone people? Extend life indefinitely? Each breakthrough comes with an ethical minefield.

discovery.text: Bioethics committees exist worldwide, but they're always playing catch-up. Technology advances faster than moral frameworks.

twist.text: Different cultures draw different lines. What's acceptable in one country may be criminal in another. There's no global consensus.

climax.text: The decisions we make about biotech today will define what it means to be human for generations to come.

punchline.text: Biology gave us the tools to redesign life. Ethics must decide how far we go.

quiz.question: Why is bioethics always playing catch-up?
options: Technology advances faster than moral frameworks can develop
